item.title: Missing traffic bollard from island, 20th February
item.description:
A member of public reported this issue: received on: 17/02/2026 05:51 Comments: Due to missing Illuminated Bollard at Traffic Island, near main road at Sydenham Rise SE23: I Drove over un visibly marked island, at the time of the incident, it was dark and raining heavily. As the road bends on the main road at this location and vehicles were parked on the left-hand side (in the bus lane), visibility was already reduced. The central refuge island did not have its usual fluorescent yellow illuminated bollard with the directional arrow. It appears the bollard had been knocked off and had not been replaced. Due to the absence of the illuminated warning bollard and the poor weather conditions, the island was not sufficiently visible. As a result, my vehicle struck the raised kerb of the refuge island, causing immediate and significant damage. Three tyres burst instantly and required replacement. Under Section 41 of the Highways Act 1980, the Council has a duty to maintain the highway in a safe condition. A missing illuminated bollard on a central refuge island presents a foreseeable hazard, particularly at night and in adverse weather conditions. The lack of appropriate warning signage materially contributed to this incident. Date of Travel: 15/02/2026 Time of Travel: 07:00

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sydenham Hill, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old fridge has been fly tipped on street, 20th February

item.title: Reported previously - Bottle of urine, 20th February
item.description:
I reported this yesterday but the case was closed without action. The bottle is still there on the pavement. Your guy walked down the wrong side of the road / straight past it. Can this now be dealt with properly please. 2 photos attached showing the location of the bottle. Please let me know if I should go and chalk an arrow on the ground.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dulwich Wood Park, Greater London
